Provides unique pvp challenges with plenty of customization to suit my play style.

Good game! Amazing how despite the game mechanics remaining the same, it is still fun to play. Great content and fun skins for so many characters. Enjoy the variety in killers and perks and it makes it fun to come up with new strategies.

This game used to be fun. (For both killers and survivors). Since the MMR update, playing killer has been a nightmare. Everyone is above you in rank and they all bring in meta perks such as ds, deadhard, unbreakable, etc. All this game has become is killers getting bullied by survivors. When you attempt to get in a survivor match, the wait time is like 10 minutes because no one wants to play killer. All in all this game is a waste of time and I would not recommend.

Dieses Spiel ist eigentlich einer der besten Spielen die ich je besessen habe. Jedes mal wenn ich in eine Runde komme, da kriege ich immer Vorfreude auf den Spielverlauf der Runde. Oft kann man im gutem Gewissen die Runde gewinnen aber gibt es so manche Runden die dich verzweifeln lassen können. Es macht sehr viel Spaß dieses Spiel zu spielen aber man kann dafür auch eine Hass-Liebe empfinden. Jedenfalls kann ich das Spiel nur empfehlen!
Dont play it

Game is horrible. Survivors are encouraged to be visibly in the open and start chase with killers. Looping at higher MMR is all you have to look forward to as killer. Run around loop 3 times and drop pallet, move on to next loop. What a stupid game mechanic. It's the only one that survivors use. It's the only safe mechanic for survivors to milk, so of course it's in their favor to do it.  That's what they call "skilled" at higher MMR. No one wants to play killer anymore. It feels powerless as a killer to chase a single survivor as the other 3 gen rush to finish the match. I guess master Nurse is your only option. Have fun sinking in 2k hours to do so before game is fun for killer.

Лучший симулятор беспомощности. Ты злой и страшный маньяк, а вокруг тебя выжившие водят хороводы с фонариками, в итоге сбегая вчетвером.

Dead by Daylight меня затянула на несколько дней и я просто постоянно играла. Эта игра понравилась тем, что она простая и четко прописаны задачи, которые должны выполнить игроки.
Мне особенно нравится режим за выжившего. Зацепил меня и я постоянно только в этот режим играю.
Конечно, бывают лаги, но в принципе они не сильно мешают играть.
Ещё мне нравится, что есть много интересных дополнений, которые дают тебе новые карты для игр, выживших и маньяков. А также мне нравится, что можно своего персонажа менять и это происходит с валютой, которая существует внутри игры. Повышая свой уровень вы получаете валюту и можете её тратить на новые навыки персонажа или на новую одежду.
Ещё один плюс заключается в том, что у каждого персонажа существуют свои персональные навыки, которые можно прокачивать и менять на другие, открывая их в паутине прокачки персонажа.
Так что если вам нравится подобный жанр игр, то можете покупать эту игру.

It was a really good game, built on a solid idea, but developers are hellbent on making new content and more dlc's instead of fixing the abundance of issues present in the game.

please BHVR just instead of a new killer or something do a QoL chapter or two

I love this game honestly but I can't recommend it in its current state. Not only is the game still rather buggy though I'll be honest that will never be fixed. But the devs somewhat recently(months ago by the time of this review) added a "skill based matchmaking" system which only takes the bare minimum of information as skill(how many full sacrifices you get as killer and how many escapes as survivor) which doesn't properly calculate your skill in the games mechanics. But the worst part is probably just trying to play with this new matchmaking system. Its a bit of a mixed bag for people. Especially at first since its still trying to calculate your ranking but its gotten to the point for me where none of my matches on killer are fun at all anymore. Either I get completely steamrolled or I completely steamroll the survivors. And most of the time when I get steamrolled its the toxic players that insult you for no reason as well. Or I get people who I'm 80% sure are hacking but can't tell because its just subtle enough which is actually a big problem right now from what I've been seeing. Now if behavior fixes the matchmaking system and gets rid of the cheaters then I would recommend the game. Even more so if they doubled down on the toxicity and actually punished people for it like they say they will in the report system. But until at least the matchmaking problem is fixed I can't in good faith say to buy this game. For the first time ever since playing it this game has actually just emotionally drained me because of these issues and I can say without a doubt this is probably the worst state the game has been in.

I used to think this game was bad due to the overwhelmingly toxic community and stressful dynamic between survivor and killer. But honestly, now that i think about it, it's not inherently the game's fault that it can be stressful, it's on you and how you choose to react to what happens in the game. As a killer main, i don't have great matches all the time, sometimes the survivors destroy me completely. That's fine, it's kind of foolish to expect to have matches where you perform outstandingly every single time. As a wise man once said, there's always gonna be a korean guy that is better than you.

Even with it's actual issues (such as hackers and bugs) i still recommend the game, as it can be a fun experience if you can not get tilted.

game can either be intense or a casual way to kill time. my friends and i are having one hell of a time joining the community so many years after its released.

Highlights:

✅ Short games. Each game usually lasts 10-15 minutes, which is nice if you don't have the time to commit to a long game.
✅ Large variety of killers that have unique powers to master. There are common killer mechanics that all killers share. Also keeps games fresh as survivor.
✅ Unique gameplay. Skills from other games don't readily translate to this game, which makes for a fun learning experience. Skill curve takes most hundreds of hours to master.

The game's not perfect however.

👎 Killer can ruin experience of a single survivor by camping hook. This usually results in the other survivors escaping if they play accordingly, but that's little consolation for the camped survivor. Also requires camped survivor to waste their time by staying in the game while their team escapes; giving up rewards the killer and enables them to find and camp another survivor.
👎 Killers and survivors can spend resources to bring additional tools to assist them in the trial. These give their side an advantage that can make the game feel less fair. So you may win some games you otherwise would have lost (and vice versa for your opponents) due to bringing stronger tools.

😄All that said it's a fun experience and I'd recommend the game to anyone that's looking for a new game to try out. The one piece of advice I'd give is to play both survivor and killer in the beginning. Only killers can see survivor scratch marks, and only survivors can hear the killer terror radius and see their red stain. So understanding these mechanics when you play the other side will help you get better.
